title: London 2012 Olympic Games Gold Medalist Gabrielle Douglas Inspires Kids from the YMCA in Final Citi Field Kids Event of the Season
summary: New York, N.Y - Citi held its final Citi Field Kids event for the 2012 season when the New York Mets hosted the Colorado Rockies at Citi Field. The event featured Gabrielle Douglas, who won the all-around individual women's gold medal in gymnastics at the London 2012 Olympic Games. The 16-year-old Douglas, who was also part of the gold medal-winning U.S. squad that won the team competition, made history by becoming the first American gymnast to win gold in both the individual all-around and team competitions at the same Olympics. Prior to the day's game, she shared her inspiring story of success with kids from the YMCA.
tag-1: London 2012 Olympic Games Gold Medalist Gabrielle Douglas Inspires Kids from the YMCA in Final Citi Field Kids Event of the Season
tag-3: New York, N.Y – Citi held its final Citi Field Kids event for the 2012 season when the New York Mets hosted the Colorado Rockies at Citi Field. The event featured Gabrielle Douglas, who won the all-around individual women's gold medal in gymnastics at the London 2012 Olympic Games. The 16-year-old Douglas, who was also part of the gold medal-winning U.S. squad that won the team competition, made history by becoming the first American gymnast to win gold in both the individual all-around and team competitions at the same Olympics. Prior to the day's game, she shared her inspiring story of success with kids from the YMCA.
tag-4: SNY anchor and reporter Michelle Yu once again served as master of ceremonies, and the program also included a presentation by Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholarship alumnus Angela Frost, who graduated this past spring from the University of Texas at Austin with a BBA in Finance and a BS in Kinesiology. She has been participating in an internship with the New York Mets this summer.
tag-5: "Citi is delighted to welcome Gabrielle Douglas to Citi Field Kids, and we congratulate her on an amazing performance in London that made this entire country proud," said Billy Cho, Citibank Area Director, New York City. "We are certain that Gabrielle's heartwarming story of dedication and sacrifice en route to becoming an Olympic champion will inspire, motivate and resonate with these kids. We're very pleased to join with the Mets and the Jackie Robinson Foundation to positively affect young lives right here in Citi's hometown."
tag-6: Now in its fourth season, Citi Field Kids is an educational and motivational community-based initiative for New York City middle and high school students developed by Citi in collaboration with the Jackie Robinson Foundation and the Mets. Citi Field Kids was launched on April 15, 2009, in conjunction with Major League Baseball's annual Jackie Robinson Day.
tag-7: The series of in-season events has sought to positively impact students through the nine values and ideals of Jackie Robinson, the legendary pioneer and great American trailblazer who broke baseball's color barrier with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947. The nine values he embodied – courage, integrity, determination, persistence, citizenship, justice, commitment, teamwork and excellence – serve as a focal point of the Jackie Robinson Rotunda at Citi Field to advance and perpetuate Robinson's humanitarian ideals.
tag-8: Dave Howard, Executive Vice President, Business Operations, New York Mets, said, "The Citi Field Kids program is one of many community initiatives that are vital and integral to our partnership with Citi. We are honored to host such a tremendous group at this CFK event and help have a profound effect on their lives."
tag-9: "The Y is excited to be a part of such an exciting event with Citi Field Kids and Gabrielle Douglas," said Gary Laermer, chief development officer of the YMCA of Greater New York. "At the Y, we challenge our kids to pursue their interests and to be the best that they can be – all while having fun."
tag-10: Each Citi Field Kids visit begins with a pre-game tour of the Jackie Robinson Rotunda and the Mets Hall of Fame led by former Jackie Robinson Foundation Scholars, and each participant in the program will receive a complimentary gift bag and lunch.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-12: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://blog.citigroup.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-13: The YMCA of Greater New York  The YMCA of Greater New York is, and always will be, dedicated to building healthy, confident, connected and secure children, adults, families and communities. With a focus on youth development, healthy living and social responsibility, the Y nurtures the potential of every youth and teen, improves New York City's health and well-being and provides opportunities to give back and support neighbors. In scores of neighborhoods across the five boroughs and its camp upstate, the Y makes accessible the support and opportunities that empower more than 400,000 New Yorkers to learn, grow and thrive. Visit ymcanyc.org.
